org.apache.ambari.server.controller.internal

Interface ArtifactResourceProvider.TypeRegistration

  • Enclosing class:
    ArtifactResourceProvider

    public static interface ArtifactResourceProvider.TypeRegistration
    Used to register a dynamic sub-resource with an existing resource type.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String fromPersistId(String value)
      Convert the persist id form of the foreign key which is written to the database to the form used by the api.

      Determine if the instance identified by the provided properties exists.

      Convert the foreign key value to a value that is persisted to the database.

    • Method Detail

      • setManagementController

        void setManagementController(AmbariManagementController controller)
        Allows the management controller to be set on the registration. This is called as part of the registration process. For registrations that need access to the management controller, they should assign this controller to a member field.
        Parameters:
        controller - management controller

      • getType

        Resource.Type getType()
        Get the type of the registering resource.
        Returns:
        type of the register resource

      • getFKPropertyName

        String getFKPropertyName()
        Full foreign key property name to use in the artifact resource. At this time, all foreign key properties should be in the "Artifacts" category.
        Returns:
        the absolute foreign key property name. For example: "Artifacts/cluster_name

      • getShortFKPropertyName

        String getShortFKPropertyName()
        Shortened foreign key name that is written to the database. This name doesn't need to be in any category but must be unique across all registrations.
        Returns:
        short fk name. For example: "cluster_name"

      • toPersistId

        String toPersistId(String value)
            throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Convert the foreign key value to a value that is persisted to the database. In most cases this will be the original value.

        An example of when this will be different is when the fk value value needs to be converted to the unique id for the resource.

        For example, the cluster_name to the cluster_id.

        This returned value will later be converted back to the normal form via fromPersistId(String).

        Parameters:
        value - normal form of the fk value used by the api
        Returns:
        persist id form of the fk value
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if unable to convert the value

      • fromPersistId

        String fromPersistId(String value)
              throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Convert the persist id form of the foreign key which is written to the database to the form used by the api. In most cases, this will be the same.

        This method takes the value returned from toPersistId(String) and converts it back to the original value which is used by the api.

        An example of this is the converting the cluster name to the cluster id in toPersistId(String) and then back to the cluster name by this method. The api always uses the cluster name so we wouldn't want to return the id back as the value for a cluster_name foreign key.

        Parameters:
        value - persist id form of the fk value
        Returns:
        normal form of the fk value used by the api
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if unable to convert the value

      • getForeignKeyInfo

        Map<Resource.Type,String> getForeignKeyInfo()
        Get a map of ancestor type to foreign key.

        Note: Currently, if a parent resource has also registered the same dynamic resource, the foreign key name used here has to match the value returned by the parent resource in getFKPropertyName()

        Returns:
        map of ancestor type to foreign key

      • instanceExists

        boolean instanceExists(Map<Resource.Type,String> keyMap,
                       Map<String,Object> properties)
                throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Determine if the instance identified by the provided properties exists.
        Parameters:
        keyMap - map of resource type to foreign key properties
        properties - request properties
        Returns:
        true if the resource instance exists, false otherwise
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - an exception occurs trying to determine if the instance exists
